-> Can affect the scalp, eyebrows, eyelashes, and other hair-bearing areas of the body
-> An autoimmune disorder in which the immune system attacks the hair follicles. T-cell mediated inflammation around the hair bulb leads to hair loss.
-> Family history of alopecia or other autoimmune diseases (e.g. thyroid disease and vitiligo)
-> Progressive hair thinning and loss, following a specific pattern
-> Men- receding hairline and thinning at the crown (vertex) of the scalp
-> Women- diffuse thinning over the crown while maintaining the frontal hairline
-> Dihydrotestosterone (DHT), a derivative of testosterone, binds to androgen receptors in hair follicles, leading to miniaturization and shortening of the hair growth cycle (anagen phase)
